cycle.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order
cycle.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Sometimes the only way to break the cycle of violence in the home is for the wife to leave.
cycle.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the period of time needed for a machine to finish a process
cycle.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: This washing machine has a 50-minute cycle.
cycle.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a group of songs, poems etc that are all about a particular important event
cycle.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order
cycle.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Dragonflies develop wings in the last stage of their life cycle.
the annual cycle of planting and harvesting crops
the natural cycle of birth and death
Illness can disrupt your menstrual cycle.
Advanced economies seem to go through a regular cycle.
If people can get jobs, they can break the cycle of poverty and debt.
The birds were able to complete their breeding cycle as farmers delayed cutting the hedges.
a cycle of poverty/activity/birth and death etc
the cycle of violence between the two countries
The country is trapped in a cycle of poverty and under-development.
the recovery phase of the economic cycle
cycle.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a bicycle or motorcycle
cycle.translation[0].note_box[1].section: Cars are not allowed in the cycle lanes.
The forest is full of beautiful cycle paths.
I bought a map of all the cycle routes in the area.
We went for a 20 km cycle ride.
the annual cycle race around France
He wasn’t wearing a cycle helmet.
Cycle hire is available in the town centre.
cycle.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to go through a series of related events again and again, or to make something do this
cycle.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The water is cycled through the machine and reused.
cycle.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a series of events that happen in an order that regularly repeats itself
cycle.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Approved Training Practices are monitored by the Association on a five-year cycle.
